channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2023100870
item.description:
Report E-2023100870

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of CS 524 Yellow M2 (UN1133) was released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3191494 at dock door 3. The terminal advised they could clean the spill with PPE on hand, (1) 85 gallon DF contains one 55-gallon metal drum of CS 524 Yellow M2 and Oil Dri was created as waste. The waste was staged and left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023100377
item.description:
Report X-2023100377

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO BOXLINE 1 TOP SLIDE FOR A POWDERY SUBSTANCE SPILL. AFTER QUICKLY EXAMINING THE PACKAGE, HE NOTICED THE 1.4C D.O.T. DIAMOND LABEL WITH HAZARD SHIPPING PAPERS. RESPONDER IMMEDIATELY SHUT THE BOXLINE OFF, EVACUATED ALL PERSONNEL, CONTACTED THE FULLTIME SUPERVISOR AND MADE HIM AWARE OF THE SITUATION.

item.title: Report X-2023100368
item.description:
Report X-2023100368

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DOOR 26 IN THE UNLOAD. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: The bag of UN3378 was punctured and leaking in trailer 83703. The operations supervisor is unsure whether or not the freight was ~damaged in transit or during unloading. He claims it is likely the checker punctured the bag with the skid of freight in front of the skid of ~UN3378 when unloading the t railer.

item.title: Report X-2023100201
item.description:
Report X-2023100201

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet package came off trailer # 819892 already damaged wet upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 4 liter glass bottles of acetonitrile 2 4 liter glass bottles had loose caps allowing .50 liters from each bottle to release package did have slotted partitions and cardboard liner on top and bottom but no bags or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: 2 4 liter glass bottles had loose caps allowing .50 liters from each bottle to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023081370
item.description:
Report X-2023081370

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiber board box with signs of release containing a class 8 was discovered at the MDTR facility. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent observed two plastic bottles with two smaller fiberboard box and bubble wrap for dunnage. One bottle had released all of its contents inside of the fiberboard box. All the contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration for movement. Shipper informed that they wanted the shipment disposed of as hazardous material.
